column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////The crust just wasn't for me. It was very crispy and buttery but too hard. There was none of the soft
column2: moist bready center that other Chicago deep dishes feature. Some people may enjoy the fact that the crust has a substantial amount of density
column3: but I wanted something with more yeast
column4: a little lighter. The sauce was unremarkable and the big sausage patty was good
column5: but on the overwhelming side. The pizza was good
column6: but I wouldn't head back here for my signature Chicago-style. It's all a matter of personal preference. Find your own!
